item.text: Manasseh was twelve years old when he became king, and he reigned for fifty-five years in Jerusalem. His mother was Hephzibah.
He did evil in the sight of the Lord and committed the same horrible sins practiced by the nations whom the Lord drove out before the Israelites.

He <st data-num="07725 01129">rebuilt</st> the <st data-num="01116" class="">high places</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st> had <st data-num="06" class="">destroyed</st>; he <st data-num="06965" class="">set up</st> <st data-num="04196" class="">altars</st> for <st data-num="01168" class="">Baal</st> and <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> an <st data-num="0842" class="">Asherah pole</st> just <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0256" class="">Ahab</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> had <st data-num="06213" class="">done</st>. He <st data-num="07812" class="">bowed down</st> to <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="06635" class="">stars</st> in the <st data-num="08064" class="">sky</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="05647" class="">worshiped</st><n id="2" /> them.
He built altars in the Lord’s temple, about which the Lord had said, “Jerusalem will be my home.”
In the two courtyards of the Lord’s temple he built altars for all the stars in the sky.

He passed his son through the fire and practiced divination and omen reading. He set up a ritual pit to conjure up underworld spirits and appointed magicians to supervise it. He did a great amount of evil in the sight of the Lord, provoking him to anger.

He put an idol of Asherah he had made in the temple, about which the Lord had said to David and to his son Solomon, “This temple in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, will be my permanent home.

I will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> make <st data-num="07272 03478">Israel</st> <st data-num="03254" class="">again</st> <st data-num="05110 04480">leave</st> the <st data-num="0127 0834">land</st> I <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> to their <st data-num="01" class="">ancestors</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07535" class="">provided</st> <st data-num="0518" class="">that</st> they <st data-num="08104" class="">carefully</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">obey</st> <st data-num="03605 0834">all</st> I <st data-num="06680" class="">commanded</st> them, the <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="08451 0834">law</st> my <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st> <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> <st data-num="06680" class="">ordered</st> them <st data-num="06680">to obey</st>.”
But they did not obey, and Manasseh misled them so that they sinned more than the nations whom the Lord had destroyed from before the Israelites.
So the Lord announced through his servants the prophets:

“<st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> has <st data-num="03282 0834 06213">committed</st> <st data-num="08441 0428">horrible sins</st>.<n id="1" /> He has <st data-num="07489" class="">sinned</st> more <st data-num="03605 0834 06213">than</st> the <st data-num="0567" class="">Amorites</st> <st data-num="0834 06440">before</st> him and has <st data-num="02398" class="">encouraged</st> <st data-num="01571 03063">Judah</st> <st data-num="02398" class="">to sin</st> by worshiping his <st data-num="01544" class="">disgusting idols</st>.<n id="2" />
So this is what the Lord God of Israel has said, ‘I am about to bring disaster on Jerusalem and Judah. The news will reverberate in the ears of those who hear about it.

I will <st data-num="05186 05921">destroy</st> <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> the <st data-num="06957" class="">same way</st> I did <st data-num="08111" class="">Samaria</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="04949" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">dynasty</st> of <st data-num="0256" class="">Ahab</st>.<n id="2" /> I will <st data-num="04229" class="">wipe</st> <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> <st data-num="04229" class="">clean</st>, just <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> one <st data-num="04229 04229 02015">wipes</st> a <st data-num="06747" class="">plate</st> on <st data-num="02015" class="">both</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">sides</st>.<n id="3" />

I will <st data-num="05203" class="">abandon</st> this <st data-num="07611" class="">last remaining tribe</st> among my <st data-num="05159" class="">people</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="05414" class="">hand</st> them <st data-num="03027" class="">over</st> to their <st data-num="0341" class="">enemies</st>; they will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> <st data-num="0957" class="">plundered</st> and <st data-num="04933" class="">robbed</st> by <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> their <st data-num="0341" class="">enemies</st>,<n id="2" />
because they have done evil in my sight and have angered me from the time their ancestors left Egypt right up to this very day!’”
Furthermore Manasseh killed so many innocent people, he stained Jerusalem with their blood from end to end, in addition to encouraging Judah to sin by doing evil in the sight of the Lord.
The rest of the events of Manasseh’s reign and all his accomplishments, as well as the sinful acts he committed, are recorded in the scroll called the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
Manasseh passed away and was buried in his palace garden, the garden of Uzzah, and his son Amon replaced him as king.
Amon was twenty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned for two years in Jerusalem. His mother was Meshullemeth, the daughter of Haruz, from Jotbah.
He did evil in the sight of the Lord, just as his father Manasseh had done.

He <st data-num="01980" class="">followed</st> in the <st data-num="03605 01870">footsteps</st> <st data-num="0834 01980">of</st> his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="05647" class="">worshiped</st> and <st data-num="07812" class="">bowed down</st> to the <st data-num="01544" class="">disgusting idols</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> had <st data-num="05647" class="">worshiped</st>.<n id="3" />
He abandoned the Lord, God of his ancestors, and did not follow the Lord’s instructions.

<st data-num="0526" class="">Amon’s</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> <st data-num="07194" class="">conspired</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> him and <st data-num="04191" class="">killed</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> in his <st data-num="01004" class="">palace</st>.
The people of the land executed all those who had conspired against King Amon, and they made his son Josiah king in his place.
The rest of Amon’s accomplishments are recorded in the scroll called the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
He was buried in his tomb in the garden of Uzzah, and his son Josiah replaced him as king.
